title: window.name via eval
description: Demonstrates a DOM-based XSS where attacker-controlled data from window.name is executed with eval().
objectives: See how window.name can be populated by a previous navigation.
Identify eval() as the unsafe sink.
Execute arbitrary JavaScript by controlling window.name.
hints: Set window.name in the DevTools console, e.g., window.name="alert(document.domain)".
Reload or revisit the page so the stored window.name value is executed.
